Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has water and light, showing it healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing signs that it is not growing well (e.g., wilted).
The student can draw a plant without light, showing signs that it is not growing well (e.g., no leaves or flowers).
The student can use drawings to show that plants need water and light to live and grow.
The student can identify patterns from their drawings that indicate the importance of water and light for plant growth.
